text:
HI all, i have a question about Pop up forms.
do I need to do anything custom in my template to support HubSpot popover forms because we think one of the popover forms is not disappearing for the people that entered the email. any idea how to test and implement this?
Thanks!

Hey dude, good to see you back in here! There is still no way to do this unfortunately, I've been pining for a CTA API / client side library similar to custom Google Analytic events for years, but no traction :confused:
Reminder: "looking for HubSpot work? Check out <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>. Folks post both new job opportunities and projects they need help with there!" every 4 mon.

this is probably due to the password field, non-HubSpot forms have a limitation to some sencitive fields like card numbers/passwords/ccv etc...
You can see more details about issues with non-HubSpot forms in this link
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/pop-up-forms-and-non-HubSpot-forms-faq#do-non-HubSpot-forms-work-with-my-form-builder>

I’m currently scoping out a HubSpot CMS project. The wireframe includes some content that is reusable such as Testimonials and Case Studies. I’m curious how you typically handle that type of content. Do you make each one a Blog? I want to reuse the testimonials in a carousel, and the Case Studies in a card layout on the homepage. I’m not sure how that works. Any insights would be greatly appreciated.
<@U6MHBFW1K> I was told you’d have the answer. :)

I’m not sure there is a great solution for this on membership CMS pages, though I also am not on the files team anymore. Maybe <@U01NW31S9EH> has seen this use case or would have some options to present here
